de.fhg.fit.biomos.sensorplatform.tools

Interface Gatttool

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GatttoolImpl, VirtualPolarH7Mock

    public interface Gatttool
extends Runnable
    Controller class for gatttool command line tool from Bluez. You use one Gatttool per Sensor. Gatttool is an interactive(!) tool for Bluetooth Low Energy Gatt functions.
    Author:
    Daniel Pyka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Gatttool.State

      void disconnect()
      Disconnect gracefully from the sensor.
      void exitGatttool()
      Exit gatttool gracefully to properly shut down the process and release all resources.
      Gatttool.State getInternalState()
      Expose the internal state of the Gatttool.
      BufferedWriter getStreamToSensor()
      Expose process input stream to be used in a sensorobject.

    • Method Detail

      • getInternalState

        Gatttool.State getInternalState()
        Expose the internal state of the Gatttool. SensorOverseer makes use of it.
        Returns:
        State the state the gatttool is currently in

      • addObs

        FIXME remove
        Parameters:
        abstractSensorWrapper - the observer

      • getStreamToSensor

        BufferedWriter getStreamToSensor()
        Expose process input stream to be used in a sensorobject.
        Returns:
        stream to the gatttool process

      • connectBlocking

        boolean connectBlocking(int timeout)
        Try to connect to a sensor.
        Parameters:
        timeout - int number of seconds to try connecting
        Returns:
        true if connected successfully, false otherwise

      • reconnect

        void reconnect()
        Try to connect again to a sensor, if gatttool has lost the previous connection (maybe because sensor went offline).

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect gracefully from the sensor.

      • exitGatttool

        void exitGatttool()
        Exit gatttool gracefully to properly shut down the process and release all resources.
